comments.author: reagansimms
comments.body: You can go here Known Alts of any-one - A User Generated List Mk IV (2022 Q3) [MODERATED] and report everything there, someone will follow up on your report, if all your accusations are proven, he will be stabbed with red ink immediately.

comments.author: hosemary
comments.body: Quote from: RAHATKHAN244 on September 30, 2022, 03:35:35 AMHe is a scammer, scam with many people also with me..You should tell us how you got scammed and provide some evidence to prove your claim. Also, " Beginners & Help" board has nothing to do with this topic. You should move it to "Scam accusations" board.

comments.author: hd49728
comments.body: Providing social media usernames and addresses are not enough to call someone as scammer and cheater.You must provide more evidence to link their accounts if you call them as cheaters. If you want to call them as scammers, you must provide proof of scams.If it is scam, you can move this topic and add more information too, to this board Scam accusationsIf it is cheating, you can move this topic to Reputation

comments.author: Cantsay
comments.created_time: September 30, 2022, 06:11:30 AMLast edit: September 30, 2022, 06:23:32 AM by Cantsay
comments.body: Quote from: RAHATKHAN244 on September 30, 2022, 03:35:35 AM[...]First of all Op this is not the right board to make a scam accusation, just as the others have said you should consider moving this thread to the  Reputation  section. You should try to put together some evidence that indeed both accounts are connected rather than just listing some telegram accounts... But I did take a look at those wallet address you provided and it seems as if both have made transaction with each other. According to Bscscan 0x06d06C01Aaf0Af1b88824A7bcCaBD0743f8D026A made four transfer into 0x2aD895aE271887DFA2Df4856734b48E9d0B20449 and also 0x2aD895aE271887DFA2Df4856734b48E9d0B20449 made three deposit into  0x06d06C01Aaf0Af1b88824A7bcCaBD0743f8D026A You can check out the transactions here:  1 | 2  |  3 |  4 | 5 | 6 | 7  While according to PolygonScan; 0x06d06C01Aaf0Af1b88824A7bcCaBD0743f8D026A made a single deposit into  0x2aD895aE271887DFA2Df4856734b48E9d0B20449 you can also check it out here: https://polygonscan.com/tx/0xa68ba729005b7c7424a844d9ca6e1b0ad08be716ffc0d74b06fc4bf22b6f8e61But I still doubt if this transaction will be considered as a proof but Op you could try to find out if they've used same telegram account or wallet to register for any campaign in the past. Raselshorif has already been tagged so the probability of him having an alts is high. Quote from: reagansimms on September 30, 2022, 03:50:37 AMYou can go here Known Alts of any-one - A User Generated List Mk IV (2022 Q3) [MODERATED] and report everything there, [...]He/she won't be allowed to make any report there because according to the rule of the thread only member rank and above are allowed. If he/she should make any report there his post will get deleted he did the right thing creating a thread but the only problem here is that he made the thread in a wrong board.

comments.author: EarnOnVictor
comments.body: You have been furnished with the right place to make a proper report, so I don't have to do that again and I guess that will cool your nerves a little bit.Still, what I could infer is that the OP is somehow that is at a quest of vendetta or trying to ruin a close someone due to one reason or another. To the extent that the person's Twitter, Discord and Wallet addresses are all revealed in this expose.I hope the admin and moderators in their wisdom would attend to this case wisely and insightfully.

comments.author: hosemary
comments.body: Quote from: Cantsay on September 30, 2022, 06:11:30 AMBut I still doubt if this transaction will be considered as a proof but Op you could try to find out if they've used same telegram account or wallet to register for any campaign in the past. There's a more strong proof. The same twitter account has been used by both accounts. Quote from: RaselShorif on September 29, 2022, 12:16:54 PMTwitter Profile Link: https://twitter.com/MdRasel07487947?s=09Quote from: Habibmim on September 25, 2022, 03:55:49 PMTwitter profile link : https://twitter.com/MdRasel07487947?s=09To OP:However it's proved that both accounts are owned by a same person, it doesn't enough to call the user a cheater, unless he/she has participated in a same campaign with both accounts.And it doesn't make the user a scammer.

comments.author: yahoo62278
comments.body: Honestly, there's a good number of bounty people that are cheaters. It's impossible to stop them nor does it do any good tagging them. They'll just create 100 newbie accounts and resume their activities. If you want to report users, it's better to report those that you know or find that are cheating btc paying campaigns. Those are the ones that would be hurt by being tagged.

comments.author: Stalker22
comments.body: Both accounts also used the same Telegram username:Quote from: Habibmim on September 20, 2020, 08:29:57 PMBitcointalk Username: HabibmimTelegram Username:@Habib1445~archive: https://ninjastic.space/post/55234219Quote from: RaselShorif on November 27, 2020, 03:27:16 PMForum Username: RaselShorifTelegram Username: @Habib1445~archive: https://ninjastic.space/post/55695841Judging by all this evidence, there is no doubt that these are alt accounts. Both of them participated (or applied) in numerous campaigns where participation with multiple accounts was prohibited.

comments.author: Awaklara
comments.body: Quote from: Stalker22 on September 30, 2022, 03:56:01 PMJudging by all this evidence, there is no doubt that these are alt accounts. Both of them participated (or applied) in numerous campaigns where participation with multiple accounts was prohibited. indeed both accounts look applied to the same campaign. but it seems in the spreadsheet the @RaselShorif account is always rejected by the campaign manager because of the tags it received.as in the Orijin Finance bounty campaign. both are listed in the spreadsheet. but only @Habibmim accounts are accepted.Quote from: RaselShorif on February 21, 2022, 10:20:15 AM#Proof Of RegistrationForum Username: RaselShorifForum Profile Link: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=profile;u=2461727Telegram Username: @Habib1445Participated Campaigns: TwitterPolygon Wallet Address: 0x06d06C01Aaf0Af1b88824A7bcCaBD0743f8D026AQuote from: Habibmim on February 25, 2022, 12:32:37 PMFormat:#Proof Of RegistrationForum Username: HabibmimForum Profile Link: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=profile;u=2854438Telegram Username: @Liton2222Participated Campaigns: TwitterPolygon Wallet Address: 0x1960820037C7104BFd64AAC6C19dF6B0484969d3@Habibmim account has also been blacklisted from the @julerz12. maybe because of the use of social media accounts that have been marked by @julerz12, he is always rejected when registering in managed campaigns.

comments.author: lovesmayfamilis
comments.body: It so happened among the bounty hunters that there are no sinless ones among them. That's what happened to the OP. While he was quietly sitting in his bounty section, he did not attract attention, but as soon as he pointed a finger at someone exactly like him, a cheater, then he himself turned out to be not quite clean.OP, what about the number of your banned accounts?You are also breaking the rules.https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5094661.msg61028113#msg61028113

comments.author: decodx
comments.body: Quote from: RAHATKHAN244 on September 30, 2022, 03:35:35 AMPost Removed ¬† Sorry üòêHaha, it's too late now buddy. You're already busted!You are evading the ban by using this alt account, which is against forum rules. You can expect the moderators to ban this account as well.

You're already busted!You are evading the ban by using this alt account, which is against forum rules. You can expect the moderators to ban this account as well.The OP exposed himself to be discovered. @lovesmayfamilis does it well.now the OP's account has been banned. in a few hours, there might already be a new account he created. it is possible to use the same address or social media account again.
